Pre-Game Insights: India has won the last two T20 series played against England and will be confident of winning this one as well on the back of the fantastic Test series win.
England has also had a fantastic T20 run, beating South Africa 3-0 in their last T20 series.
Both the teams will be eager to get their players some much-needed international T20 action to prepare for the World Cup.
India and England will play five T20 matches from 12th to 20th March 2021.
England is leading the T20 rankings, with India placed second.
R Pant: After his scintillating knock in the last Test match, it will be interesting to see if Pant can regain his T20 form against England.
Y Chahal: Not included in the squad in the recent Test series, Chahal will want to impress on a pitch favoring spinners.
A Patel: He had an amazing run in the Test series and will want to solidify his position as a dependable all-rounder on the Indian team.
A Rashid: England will be pegging their hopes on Rashid to deliver the goods on a pitch favoring spinners.
B Stokes: He gave hints of his ability in the Test series. England will hope he leads them to victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weather on 12th March '21 is likely to be very warm and sunny with an average temperature of 36 degrees celsius.
There is no chance of rain, which will make it suitable for batting.
The pitch is expected to be dusty and helpful to the spinners.
The two teams will utilize their spinners and prepare their batsmen against spin.
The 5-match T20 series is building up to the T20 World Cup, scheduled for later this year.
Both teams will be eager to get their players some much-needed international T20 action to prepare for the World Cup.
